intro: Argyropsis, commonly known as silverleaf or silverbush, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to southern Africa. These plants typically have finely divided, fern-like leaves that give them a delicate appearance. The flowers are small and clustered, often white or pale in color, and they produce small, dry fruits. Argyropsis species are often found in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
